p: Antioxidant activity values estimated by the DPPH assay are shown in Fig.Â 3(A,B). The highest value was observed for P. serotina unripe fruit, where both hydro-alcoholic and aqueous extracts showed to be 1.6 times more active than V. myrtillus unripe extracts. When fruits ripen, the statistical difference between the antioxidant activity of P. serotina extracts and that of the control species disappears, and ripe P. serotina fruits are generally two times less active that unripe ones. Phytolacca americana and L. japonica showed values of antioxidant activity quite lower than V. myrtillus, and these species also show a higher antioxidant activity in unripe conditions.
